ideas.heading: How do I define Church Membership?

subideas.text: Church membership, is an extra-biblical phrase, used to refer to the belief and subsequent actions, of the biblical requirement to limit the pertinent eclesiological duties and privileges, to biblical gospel believing members, of biblical local congregations, that are explicitly commited to obeying the biblical mandates about the local church, specifically with the members and leadership of their congregation
It's currently impossible to obey the following eclesiological biblical mandates without it:
All of this commandments require a defined group of church members to be practiced.
Therefore, in a similar manner that doctrines as the trinity, the hypostatic union, the 5 solas, and the tulip, church's membership is an implicitly biblical doctrine.
It's currently impossible to obey the previously discussed biblical mandates without it.
Every church that kares about keeping this duties will practice some form of church membership.

ideas.heading: What makes this practice currently obligatory?

subideas.text: The current unbiblical landscape of the christian church makes such an explicit application required.

The Bible presuposed a church by location when it's commandments were issued, but currently, our sin of heterodoxy and division has grown in such a manner that a single location can have 4 or five churches.

This, added to the fact that many churches doesn't teach clearly the gospel nor it's requirements for the church life and biblical discipline, has fostered the sin of lack of commitmend to the duties of the local church.
Besides, the notion of occidental individuality has hardened the conciousness of so many believers that an action is required to restore the notion of biblical fellowship and local church duties.

ideas.heading: How do I suggest to practice it?

subideas.text: The church must limit all eclesiological duties and privileges, to individuals validated by their current leadership, as biblical gospel believers and members of a local church.

This is to say, that each church should limit, all spiritual gift exercise, ministry partaking, eclesiological duties, and eclesiological privileges, to individuals recognized as current members of a biblical local church, by it's current leadership.

ideas.heading: Which are the eclesiological duties and privileges?

biblicallyJustifiedIdeaList.text: Protect the holyness of the church
Learn and teach biblical doctrine in community
Advance the gospel as a body
Build the church through spiritual gift's and ministry exercise
Live as the family of God
Remember the Lord's sacrifice through the Lord's Supper

ideas.heading: How does this impact's the duty of loving all believers?

subideas.text: We recognize our duty of loving and having comuni√≥n with all believers. Jn.17.17, Col.1.3-5, Rom.16.1-16
Therefore, we try to obey and enjoy all the inter-eclesial biblical duties and privileges. 1.cor.16

Nonetheless, we also recognize that we require limit's to keep the eclesiological biblical mandates as discussed before, therefore, we aim to keep both, the intra and inter eclesial duties and privileges with this principle:
Comunion with all biblical churches, collaboration by afinity and leadership determined benefit

This is to say that we ought to have a christian loving and truth centered comunion with all believers, but must collaborate in ministry with them judiciously, analizing each oportunity, and partaking only in activities that adorn the gospel and preverve holyness and doctrine
